Annotation.note:
The perpendiculars $DP$, $DQ$ dropped from the foot $D$ of the altitude $AD$ of the triangle $ABC$ upon the sides $AB$, $AC$ meet the perpendiculars $BP$, $CQ$ erected to $BC$ at $B$, $C$ in the points $P$, $Q$ respectively. Prove that the line $PQ$ passes through the orthocenter $H$ of $ABC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
